bibl.title: Despatch from D.L. Marsins
Despatches from United States Consuls in St Paul Loanda

div1.p: of America, as proprietor and Agent, having American and British property in charge, to formally protect against you and the French Government individually and collectively, for any loss or damage that may accrue to him through any, through any Acts caused by yours or by the French Government orders, including additional expenses and loss of time or any other damage direct or indirect.

Hoping that you will take due notice of this my formal protest, (a copy of which will be forwarded to the American Consuls at Gaboon and Loanda), and that you will kindly send me an acknowledgement of his receipt, I remain with the greatest consideration.

Most Respectly,
Your Obedt Servant
D. L. Marsins

Witness.
Antonio F. Brazao
Walter Dore
